item.title: Rainbow Six: Siege Board Game Reprint and New Expansions Coming Courtesy of Steamforged Games
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/tabletop/news/rainbow-six-siege-board-game-reprint-and-new-expansions-coming-courtesy-of

A Rainbow Six: Siege board game reprint is on the way. Steamforged Games has announced a crowdfunding campaign so that those who missed out on the first campaign can enjoy the board game adaptation of Ubisoft's shooter. The campaign has two new expansions for returning fans.

According to its Gamefound campaign page, the Rainbow Six: Siege board game reprint will include the base game and all of its expansions. As the name implies, the game is a tabletop adaptation of Ubisoft's competitive tactical shooter.

Two to four players play as a team of Operators and try to either eliminate their enemies or complete objectives before they do. Each Operator has a unique kit or special ability, allowing you to breach through walls, fortify defenses, or set up special weapons and gadgets. The base game contained 20 Operators with the expansions introducing 40 more.

If you already backed the Rainbow Six: Siege board game, this reprint campaign has two more expansions. One is a map pack, introducing the Skyscraper and Villa environments alongside cardboard obstacles. The second contains eight new Operators: Osa, Grim, Brava, Sens, Fenrir, Thorn, Solis, and Azami.

Furthermore, the Rainbow Six: Siege board game reprint campaign has a pre-order incentive. If you back the game in advance, you'll get an alternate profile and miniature for the Zero Operator at no additional cost.

The different bundles for the Rainbow Six: Siege board game reprint campaign are as follows:

  • Tactical Drop for £40.00: The new map pack and Operator Expansion
  • The Board Game for £70.00: The board game with all additional content from the first crowdfunding campaign
  • The Elite Bundle for £260.00: Everything mentioned above, All map packs, and a 3D Decor set.

The original Rainbow Six: Siege board game launched on Kickstarter in June 2021. It was originally designed and developed by Mythic Games after successfully raising $1,541,463, beating its initial funding goal of $100,000. Since the company's announced liquidation the rights to the game shifted to Steamforged Games.

You can pre-order the above mentioned bundles for the Rainbow Six: Siege board game right now.

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. This… More about Tyler
